reviews.review_msg: Really bad

Sports Econ was a pretty solid class, especially for a sports lover like myself. If you do the assignments and read his notes you will be absolutely fine. I ended up with a B after only studying for 6 hours before the final exam. I spent more time doing my assignments (which were interesting too) than I did studying! Great class.
he is a good and very nice prof, however the grading is brutal. The TA's mark HARD. Midterm is fair, but final is INSANE.

Okay course, but TAs marked very hard. MT and final all written. No calculations involved (excluding assignments). Not a sports fan, so had to do addition research for assignments. Remember key points mentioned in class. I managed to get an A despite my lack of sports knowledge. Should do ok if you only do readings up to MT and the CBA for final.

WORST class ever... the TA are just horrible they don't know anything about sports and that's why they give low mark cause they don't know what's going on... over all HORRIBLE class! no wonder they offer it every 3 years

this cls is a joke.I seriously learned nth,but the 4 major leagues,which I had never watched any of the games.If you're not a sports lover,DO NOT take this class,it will bore you out for sure. Plus,his notes is such a mess. He can break one sentences into 2 to 3 points.MT+final are fair,basically based on arguements,instead of economic knowledge.
Economic of Sports were an interesting topic. 3-4 paper on Sport teams. More material on sports than Economics, but don't really mind that! Both MT and Final were fair. Good prof. nice person.

Econ of Sports was a great class - Easy A...Curry is clear and straight forward in what he expects...to bad we didnt look more into European soccer league...might have been more interestin...i would recomend him for any class

A good prof, very clear about what he wants for exams and assignments, but overall the class was a bit of a joke. It seemed to focus (and test) a lot more on sports knowledge and issues rather than economics. I went to class sparingly and still got an A.
His exams are pretty fair.  The textbook was a bit useless though.  4 papers, so kinda gets boring after a while.  But overall course and prof was not bad.
The Final exam is quite hard.

Not that smart, but he's a good guy.  He blew his chance to make economics of sports a killer class --I learned nothing. You can learn more by reading the National Post than taking this class --although that holds true for many classes at SFU.

If you go to class and pay attention to his lectures, you'll do fine.  His lectures are very easy to follow and he will answer everyones questions either in class or by writing an email.  Overall he is a good professor.
Awsome Prof.  Doesn't mind spending time with students to clarify points.
mean marking teacher and he said that he need students to answer exam in his way otherwise he can't understand what students write about even though the students get answers.

(Game Theory) He didn't seem to care about this class at all. Average on the midterm was 8/20 - which he says is 'normal' for his classes. He shows up late and posts assignments, tutorial questions, notes and midterm review late as well. He doesn't communicate well enough with his TAs. Math is needed although not a pre-req! Avoid at all costs.

Seems like a nice guy, BUT he's very bad at teaching. He does not know how to clearly explain the concepts. Textbook is not required but I had to buy it to better understand what he talks about in class. Too bad he's the best the faculty can come up with to teach the class. He makes game theory (which is an otherwise interesting topic) boring.

I took Econ 282 (selected topics) - Game Theory with this guy and he's not as bad as people make him out to be. I didn't have a textbook, just went to all the lectures and tutorials... a warning: you need to know math for this course. Exams are fair and gives very little homework. Really chill and laid back, helpful if you ask.
great

Ben is a great prof.  He definitely is one of those profs who wants you to do well in his course.  Ended up with an A.  Got average on the midterm.  If you're good at remembering small details, you'll Ace this course@
OMG!
OMG!! His lec is so boring. He just read the notes for 2 hours. Exam is easy. But the average is so low. Its like 32/100
average is so low, after added 25 marks. class average still64/100...its useless to attend the lec. You can learn much more by read the notes uself.
Although a little unclear at times, very available for any questions that you need answered or extra help. Very fair prof for adding on 25 marks MT.

If you took some 200level econ before , this will be a very easy courses.                The subject sounds interesting, but Ben is just only reading the notes with his boring tone during the lecture. No one every ask of answer question during the lecture.                      The mean score for midterm is 37/100, but he added 25 marks for everyone
Very helpful and cares about his students. He knows what he is talking about and his grading/expectations are reasonable. I'd definitely take a class with him again.
This class was awesome!!! I learned a lot and Graham was really patient and helpful.
Professor Walker was one of the best profs I've ever had. He really went out of his way to explain things, and was an excellent teacher.

Worse teacher ever. His hypthosis testing completely different from what is taught in stats. He makes simple things super confusing and complicated (although he think it is not). And it doesn't help that his voice is very annoying. As for marking, he's not a super hard marker.
Don't take this course. Waste of money and time. It was an easy course though.
Very easy!!
Pascal is top-notch people... To be honest, formulas are not that hard to memorize... He's willing to help and he's definitely not arrogant like other professors out there... Hey, what's not to love?

Pascal is top-notch!! To be honest, formulas are not that hard to memorize people...He's willing to help his students and he's definitely not arrogant like other professors out there...Hey, what's not to love?
This is the worst teacher ever, if you can avoid taking his class, DO IT. He will not give out formulas for midterm or final and the course has 23 formulas ( i counted).
He doesn't seem interested in teaching at all. The lectures are very scattered. I wouldn't recommend taking a class with him.

Worst course I have ever taken. Prof Harris knows his stuff, and is very smart, but he should stick to research not teaching! His lecture was scattered, had little or no relevance to what was on exams AND textbooks. Course outline is very unorganized and confusing. Notes and midterms are full of typos and mistakes. Feel sorry for the TAs.
one swear word could describe him and his econ class

I can honestly say that he's a pretty bad professor. He is a very smart man, with a tremendous amount of economic knowledge, but he doesn't seem to be interested in teaching at all. His exams are ridiculously hard.
TAKE NOTES, PEOPLE! Or, if you're lucky like our class, download them ALL off the e-mail. Study them, highlight them. Forget the textbook. Useless. Only notes....noooootes.
Tests come straight out of notes and is quite clear.  When you need help he is more than willing to help.  Good guy to talk to because he is very knowledeable.  PS-Likes to use the word God Dam

Terrible at explaining. Asking questions in lecture is pretty useless, he can only explain things in mathematical terms. Speaks extremely unconfidently. Biggest pet peeve is that he frequently uses 'uhh' 'you know' to conjunct his sentences. Like bro, no, i DONT KNOW. Thats why im here. Expects you to understand things instantly. Not good.
Awful prof, irrelevant lectures, belittles everyone, and micromanages.

Lectures aren't very helpful, irrelevant to midterm and final questions, he breezes through material expecting everyone to absorb it quickly. Textbook is a must, grading on exams is unclear. The class average was 20% on the final
Junjie Liu is a nice prof because he will help me with talking Chinese language.  If you are not a Chinese, don't take this class please because his english is poor and not good enough to help you
easy to pass the course, but extremely hard to get a good grade

Very bad personality. Don't even try to talk with him. Don't even care about his students. If you fail, then it's all your problem. Has no passion on what he is teaching about. Don't like this person at all, even though I came from the same country as him.
This prof has no ability to teach at all. Needs to work on speaking English as you can't understand him at all. He brings his notes and copies it down without explanation. The worst prof ever.

Econ 282 is useless and open for making $? The class is Finance and even use 400 Finance textbook. Liu is nice BUT he knows NOTHING about Finance! Midterm 1 class avg below 50%. At least ONE mistake in each lecture note! I know cuz im 400 Finance student
This prof can't even speak English and copies down his lecture notes onto an overhead for us to copy his notes. What a waste of money by taking this course with a useless prof like Junjie Liu.
he is not as good as you think, hard exams, not recommended

Junjie's a nice prof. But he's definitely not  good at teaching/communicating his ideas during the lectures. All he does is simply regurgitating the things he read off the textbook. His notes are copy&paste from the textbook as well. I couldn't say for other courses but don't take this course with him. Spend your time/effort on something valuable.
Can't understand him and his writing most of the time. Not very nice.
